info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:08PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 407 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Raton Pass, or near Raton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton, Sugarite, Sugarite Canyon State Park and Raton Pass. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 455 and 460. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Accumulations of small hail on Interstate 25 may create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.
